title: Senior .NET Developer - Skövde
description:
### **Assignment – Senior .NET Developer (C#) with Azure and Full Stack Expertise**


We’re currently seeking a highly experienced **Senior C# .NET Developer** with a passion for building resilient and scalable software systems. This role places you at the heart of critical digital solutions that support large-scale industrial and manufacturing operations worldwide.

### **About the Role**


You’ll join a dynamic team dedicated to delivering software solutions that directly interface with manufacturing processes—helping drive the production of complex machinery across global facilities. These applications operate close to the shop floor and are vital to the smooth functioning of industrial systems.


As a senior contributor, you’ll play a leading role in the full software lifecycle—from design and architecture to implementation, deployment, and ongoing improvement. You’ll also coach less experienced developers, promote technical excellence, and champion best practices.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain full-stack solutions using modern .NET technologies
* Collaborate in an agile Scrum team focused on delivering stable, high-quality applications
* Actively engage in architectural decisions and technical discussions
* Lead by example in code quality, testing, and documentation
* Mentor junior developers and help grow team capability
* Drive improvements in CI/CD, observability, and automation pipelines
* Ensure applications meet performance, security, and scalability expectations
* Participate in code reviews, deployments, and troubleshooting across environments

### **Required Technical Skills**

* Proficiency in **C# and the .NET platform**
* Solid understanding of **SQL** and relational database structures
* Practical experience with **Microsoft Azure**, including:


	+ **Containerization** (e.g., Docker)
	+ **Orchestration** (e.g., Kubernetes)
	+ **Authorization/Identity Management**
* Familiarity with **event-driven architectures**, particularly tools like **Apache Kafka**
* Knowledge of **CI/CD pipelines** and tools such as:


	+ GitHub Actions
	+ ArgoCD
	+ GitOps workflows
* Experience building **RESTful APIs** and using **Entity Framework**
* Familiarity with front-end frameworks like **Blazor** or similar
* Competence in **automated testing methodologies**
* Experience working in **agile environments**, particularly Scrum
* Fluency in **Git-based version control workflows**

### **Bonus Points For**

* Exposure to **cloud-native observability tools** (e.g., OpenTelemetry)
* Background or domain experience in **manufacturing or automotive industries**

### **Personal Attributes We Value**

* Strong mentorship and coaching abilities
* Energetic, solution-oriented, and proactive approach to challenges
* Comfortable taking ownership and responsibility for delivery outcomes
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Collaborative, open-minded, and team-centric attitude
* Eager to innovate, learn, and share knowledge


This position requires **100% on-site presence** and is ideal for someone who thrives in high-impact technical environments where stability, precision, and cross-functional collaboration are key.

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Systemutvecklare till Skandinaviens största biljett- och...
description:
*Tillsammans med våra kunder skapar vi upplevelser och minnen för livet - och vi gör det för miljontals människor varje år.*

*Vill du vara med och skapa fler upplevelser tillsammans med oss? Vi söker hela tiden efter engagerade kollegor som vill vara med och dela vår resa.*  

  

**Om Tickster**


En gång, för inte allt för länge sedan, var Tickster festivalarrangörernas lilla uppstickarfavorit. Idag har vår plattform utvecklats till att bli Skandinaviens största biljett- och kassasystem med över 5500 arrangörer som väljer Tickster för sin försäljning och evenemangshantering. Vi säljer idag en biljett var 3:e sekund!


#Biljettenärbarabörjan. Försäljning i restauranger, barer och foodtrucks, bordsbokningssystem för dinnershows samt mobila beställningar är bara ett axplock av allt vår plattform hjälper våra kunder med. Vi är stolta över att erbjuda evenemangvärldens mest kompletta system, unikt framtaget för att våra arrangörer ska kunna hantera hela sitt evenemang på ett smidigt och effektivt sätt.


Vi är ett framgångsrikt team med kontor i Arvika och Göteborg, Oslo och Köpenhamn, stolta över vår samarbetskultur, våra kunskaper och erfarenheter – och framför allt vår förmåga att ha roligt tillsammans. Vår drivkraft framåt är att fortsätta expandera i Skandinavien och Europa - vi längtar efter att vara med och skapa upplevelser och minnen för livet hos ännu fler!


Vi letar kontinuerligt efter fler Ticksters, så är du redo att ta dig an en utmaning och bidra till vår spännande utvecklingsresa - skicka gärna in din intresseanmälan till oss!

  

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på https://jobs.tickster.com/

 **Om jobbet**


Lite beroende på vad du har för bakgrund och specialintressen kommer du ingå i ett eller flera team där du tillsammans med övriga kollegor jobbar igenom hela projektcykeln. Från att bryta ner behov och funktioner, via iterationer och test, till att slutligen se till att det som byggs går ut i produktion. Då vi rör oss fort framåt, både avseende teknik och vilka avtryck vi gör i marknaden, gillar vi att agera och fatta kloka beslut snabbt.


Vi jobbar med jämförelsevis liten administrativ overhead, vi har möten för att de behövs och ger värde – inte för syns skull. Det innebär att du kan spendera en stor del av dagen i Visual Studio (vi jobbar framförallt med .NET/C#).


Under en typisk arbetsdag pratar du (eller chattar/videosamtalar via Slack/Meet) med en massa kollegor, resonerar, ber om synpunkter eller ger råd. Förmodligen reviewar du en eller ett par PR:s och ger feedback.


Du hinner nog också snacka med till exempel System Support (som är i kontakt med och hjälper arrangörerna) för att höra hur de ser på den feature du jobbar med. Kanske ger du dig in i Elk för att ta reda på hur den här delen av systemet används och presterar, i Jira för att ta fram relaterade eller närliggande issues, eller i Sentry – allt för att få en bra bild av vad som är värt att tänka på när du löser problemet du jobbar på.  

  

**Vi tror och hoppas att du**

  

* Är en ödmjuk lagspelare som vill jobba i ett team med engagerade och drivna kollegor som verkligen gillar det de gör
* Tycker att mjukvaruutveckling är bland det roligaste som finns
* På riktigt gillar att lära dig nya saker, hela tiden
* Har relevant studieinriktning inom systemutveckling
* Är med på att kommunikation är viktigt
* Kanske har nåt specialistområde som vi saknar och delar uppfattningen att det är ett starkt lag som är det viktiga.


Om du är redo att ta dig an en spännande utmaning och ingå i ett roligt sammanhang, är du varmt välkommen att skicka in din intresseanmälan.

title: Är du en Java- och Kafka-utvecklare som vill mer?
description:
Då är det dags att upptäcka **Crepido**.


Vi är ett konsultbolag fyllt av drivna systemutvecklare som brinner för teknik – och för att skapa verklig kundnytta. Hos oss kombineras djup teknisk kompetens med en genuin förståelse för våra kunders utmaningar. Vi bygger smarta lösningar som gör skillnad – och vi gör det tillsammans.

**Nu växer vi – och söker dig som vill vara med på resan.**

**Vi tror att du:**

* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet som utvecklare
* Är vass på **Java**, med koll på **Kafka**, **Microservices** och moderna arkitekturer
* Är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att hålla dig tekniskt uppdaterad
* Trivs i team och tycker om att lyfta dina kollegor
* Har stark kommunikativ förmåga och gillar att förstå kundens behov på djupet

**Vad får du hos oss?**


Hos Crepido får du en vardag fylld av spännande tekniska utmaningar – tillsammans med riktigt sköna kollegor. Vi har en inkluderande, familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra och har kul längs vägen. Våra kontor finns i **Göteborg,** **och Skövde**, men vårt hjärta finns i varje möte vi har – med kollegor och kunder.


Vi växer – men aldrig på bekostnad av vår kultur.

**Redo för nästa steg?**


Hör av dig till **marjan@crepido.com** – vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: Senior System Developer - HPI
description:
**Vill du vara med och göra skillnad i hälsoteknikens framkant? Bli en del av HPIs engagerade team och bidra till bättre hälsa och hållbara arbetsliv!**

 **Om HPI – Ett innovativt hälsoteknikföretag**


HPI är ett växande hälsoteknikföretag som kombinerar IT-utveckling, metodutveckling, dataanalys och forskning för att leverera den ledande digitala plattformen inom hälso- och arbetsmiljöutveckling i Norden.


Genom deras plattform Plustoo erbjuder de tjänster och expertkunskap till företagshälsor, gym- och träningsanläggningar samt andra hälsoaktörer. Tillsammans hjälper de individer och arbetsgivare att främja hälsa och skapa hållbara arbetsliv. De bedriver uppmärksammad forskning i samarbete med bland annat Gymnastik- och idrottshögskolan (GIH) och har verkat i snart 50 år. Trots att de är ett mindre företag har de stor påverkan genom plattformen och deras världsunika databas med över tre decenniers insamlade data. Just nu befinner de sig i en spännande expansionsfas både i Sverige och Norge.

 **Om rollen**


Som systemutvecklare hos HPI kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av HPIs plattform Plustoo och Todaytoo.


HPI söker dig som trivs i en teamorienterad miljö och vill bidra aktivt till att nå gemensamma mål. Utvecklingsarbetet är agilt och starkt präglat av samarbete, så vi ser gärna att du är en lagspelare som gillar att dela idéer och lösningar.


Eftersom HPI hanterar känsliga personuppgifter ställer de höga krav på kvalitet och säkerhet i allt de gör. Du kommer att arbeta nära ett engagerat team som inkluderar frontend- och backend-utvecklare, produktägare och utvecklingschef. Dessutom får du möjlighet att samarbeta med deras specialister inom hälsa och arbetsmiljö, vilket ger dig insikt i hur teknik kan förbättra hälsa och skapa hållbara arbetsliv.

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**


Flera års erfarenhet av C# .NET.


Goda Entity Framework och MSSQL kunskaper.


Erfarenhet av ASP.Net Core web API.


Erfarenhet av att jobba med integrationer mot externa system.


Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

 **Det är bonus om du har:**


Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur och/eller ledarskap inom utvecklingsteam.


Praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines (TeamCity/Octopus eller liknande) och kodsignering.


Arbetat med loggning och centraliserad loggning (SEQ eller liknande) för systembevakning och felsökning.


Erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling för Windows med WinForms och ClickOnce (de fasar ut Windows-applikationen ut för webb-applikationen. Nya tjänster utvecklas främst i webb-app).


Erfarenhet av att konfigurera brandväggar och DNS-inställningar.Jobbat med Internet Information Services (IIS) och hanterat servercertifikat.

**Övrig teknik vi ser som ett plus:**

Git, JIRA och Confluence


Azure tjänster så som: Key Vault, SignalR, SSO med SAML


NoSQL: Redis, ElasticSearch


BankID


Digital signering av PDF

 **De erbjuder**


HPI drivs av en vision om ett samhälle där människor upplever en god hälsa och har ett hållbart arbetsliv. De tror starkt på att arbetsplatsen är en idealisk arena för hälsofrämjande insatser.  

  



De erbjuder bland annat:


Träning på arbetstid och friskvårdsbidrag.


Konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor.


Sex veckors semester,


Tjänstepension (ITP1)


Sjukvårdsförsäkring.


De värnar om balans mellan arbete och fritid, med flexibel arbetstid och möjligheten att arbeta i en hybrid arbetsmiljö. Även om de uppmuntrar samarbete på deras kontor på centrala Södermalm i Stockholm, ger de också möjlighet till distansarbete.


Deras rymliga kontor delas med systerbolag inom Health- och Medtech-sektorn, som ingår i deras koncern *Carasent*, vilket skapar spännande möjligheter och samarbeten.

 **Om Carasent**


Bolagen i Carasent-koncernen utvecklar och levererar ett ekosystem av integrerade SaaS-tjänster inom olika typer av vård. Genom en bred portfölj av IT-system och applikationer, som molnbaserade journalsystem, verktyg för digital patientkommunikation och digitala vårdmöten, BI-lösningar och ett flertal partnerintegrationer, erbjuder Carasent den mest flexibla lösningen för vårdgivare på den nordiska marknaden idag.

  

Carasent har idag drygt 150 anställda på sina kontor i Sverige och Norge och är listat på Oslo Börs. Kunderna återfinns inom primärvård, specialistvård, företagshälsovård och rehabilitering, primärt inom privat sektor. Huvudkontoret ligger i Göteborg.


Företag inom koncernen: Carasent Sverige, Metodika AB, Carasent NO, Medrave Software AB och HPI Health Profile Institute AB.

 **Innan anställning kan bli aktuell kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras. De använder bakgrundskontroller från SRI.**  



**Är det dig de beskrivit ovan? Då är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. De går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen ligger uppe tills de tillsatt tjänsten.**

 **Vid frågor som rör rollen kontakta gärna** *zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com**.*

title: Fullstack Engineer - Platform Developer Experience
description:
At Spotify, we are committed to empowering our teams by equipping them with groundbreaking tools that redefine productivity and efficiency. At the heart of this mission is the AiKA squad, pioneering the future of AI-powered knowledge assistance. The AiKA Backstage Plugin is revolutionizing how employees access and utilize internal knowledge, streamlining workflows, and unlocking new levels of innovation and collaboration across and beyond Spotify.
   

  

 Our squad plays a vital role in enabling R&D employees to work smarter and more effectively. We build scalable tools and systems that integrate Generative AI (GenAI) capabilities into internal processes, driving collaboration and innovation not only across Spotify but also for thousands of Backstage users worldwide. As AiKA evolves toward externalization, we are at the forefront of competing with the broader industry, fostering a dynamic, startup-like culture where innovation thrives. By joining us, you will have the unique opportunity to shape how employees worldwide interact with knowledge and tools, making their work more efficient, enjoyable, and future-focused.
   

  

 You will work with a collaborative and diverse team to build and maintain infrastructure, features, and tools that empower Spotify employees globally. Your expertise in fullstack development, Generative AI, and developer tools will be instrumental in delivering high-quality and impactful solutions.
   

  

 As with many innovative projects, your responsibilities will vary frequently. You'll work across different technologies, product domains, and teams. We seek someone passionate about thriving in this type of dynamic environment!
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, and designers to solve exciting and impactful problems, delivering value to Spotify employees and external Backstage users
* Build and maintain the AiKA Backstage Plugin, internally and externally, — our flagship knowledge assistance tool — and explore ways to incorporate Generative AI (GenAI) into Backstage workflows
* Deliver testable, maintainable, and high-quality code, and take operational responsibility for the components that you develop
* Design and maintain fullstack systems, primarily using TypeScript, Node.js, and other modern web technologies
* Contribute to technical RFCs and documentation to align approaches across the team and broader organization
* Explore creative solutions to integrate AI/ML capabilities into Spotify's developer tools
* Mentor team members, share your knowledge, and promote best practices


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have professional experience working with modern web technologies such as TypeScript, and Node.js.
* You are passionate about delivering end-to-end experiences and care about software architecture across the frontend, backend, and the APIs that glue them together.
* You have practical knowledge or experience with Backstage and are enthusiastic about improving developer tooling.
* You have experience with or are eager to work with Python, particularly for AI/ML integrations.
* You are familiar with Generative AI concepts, and hands-on experience is a huge plus.
* You have excellent communication and collaboration skills and go above and beyond to ensure alignment across diverse teams.
* You value writing high-quality, testable code and are comfortable owning your work, from development to production.
* You are eager to learn, experiment, and thrive in a dynamic environment where priorities can shift.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based Stockholm
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Core Engineering - Software Engineer - Associate - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**What We Do**
 At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering, which is comprised of core and business-aligned teams, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.
   

  

**About Data Engineering**
 Data plays a critical role in every facet of the Goldman Sachs business. The Data Engineering group is at the core of that offering, focusing on providing the platform, processes, and governance, for enabling the availability of clean, organized, and impactful data to scale, streamline, and empower our core businesses. Within Data Engineering, we focus on offering a comprehensive data platform, Legend, which we have made available as an open-source product. Legend includes a full data modeling environment, as well as the execution of data access and controls, and a vast set of value-add products which allow our business users to operate more efficiently. Leveraging our own Legend offering, our engineers build efficient data solutions that source, curate, and distribute critical data to our businesses, including financial product, pricing, transaction, and client reference data. Our engineers collaborate closely with the business to design and curate business-specific data models, and to transform and distribute data for optimal storage and retrieval.
   

  

**Who We Look For**
 Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. As a Software Engineeron the Data Engineering team, you will be responsible for helping improve the Legend data platform, our curated data offerings, and how the business uses data. We tackle some of the most complex engineering problems across distributed software development, optimizing data access and delivery, enabling core access controls via well-defined security paradigms, building UIs to enable data visualization, using machine learning to curate data, or engaging with businesses to ensure their data needs are met, and we react quickly to new demands by rapidly evolving our data solutions.
   

  

**How You Will Fulfill Your Potential**
* Design & develop modern data management tools to curate and govern our most important data sets, models and processes, while identifying areas for process automation and further efficiencies.
* Engage with data consumers and producers to help them improve the quality of their data using the data governance tooling.
* Contribute to an open-source technology - https://github.com/finos/legend .


**Basic Qualifications**
* A Bachelor or Master degree in a computational field (Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or in a related quantitative discipline).
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience in a team-focused environment.
* Strong object-oriented design and programming skills and experience in OO languages (e.g., Java).
* Fluency with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Knowledge of relational and document databases.
* Knowledge of data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Comfort with Agile operating models (practical experience of Scrum / Kanban).
* Excellent communications skills and the ability to work with subject matter experts to extract critical business concepts.
* Independent thinker, willing to engage, challenge or learn.
* Ability to stay commercially focused and to always push for quantifiable commercial impact.
* Strong work ethic, a sense of ownership and urgency.
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Financial Services industry experience


**About Goldman Sachs**
 At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
   

  

 We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
   

  

 We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
   

  

 © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
   

  

 Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veterans status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers—improving their relationships.
   

  

 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for a talented Senior Frontend Developer to help us get there.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You’ll join our Stockholm design team to shape our platform’s interface. You will work together with designers and engineering teams to craft a consistent and accessible component library, implement product features, as well as optimise build and release processes. It’s hands-on and all about creating value and impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re a React pro who writes clean, reusable code, balancing big-picture thinking with fine details. You’ve worked with component libraries or design systems and value consistency. You know when a unit test or visual regression test is needed and thrive in a small, fast-moving team where you own the process from idea to launch.
   

  

**Tech You’ll Work With**
* Typescript, React and CSS-in-JS for scalable styling
* Testing tools like Jest, Playwright and Storybook
* Analytics to track performance
* Agile workflows with tight team collaboration


**Why Work With Us?**
 At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside, you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We’re committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You’ll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
   

  

 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
   

  

 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Web Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss**
 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med branchens mest erfarna experter och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar säkra system tillsammans med våra kunder och nu söker vi fler vassa utvecklare till vårt webb-team i Stockholm.
   

  

**Att jobba som webbutvecklare på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:**
* Utvecklar och förbättrar moderna webbapplikationer.
* Designar och implementerar användarvänliga och tillgängliga gränssnitt.
* Deltar i arkitekturdiskussioner och bidrar till tekniska vägval.
* Arbetar nära våra kunder och hjälper till att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.


 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde åt våra kunder. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare och en utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Har djup erfarenhet i ett eller flera SPA-ramverk som Angular, React, Vue, och Next.js och god förståelse för modern frontend-utveckling, t.ex. TypeScript, JavaScript och komponentbaserad arkitektur.
* Är bekväm i hela stacken och har erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, t.ex. Java, .NET eller Node.js samt tekniker som Azure och/eller AWS.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska.


 Vi ser det som extra meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Angular.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
   

  

**Vi satsar på dig**
 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du ges mängder med möjligheter att fortsätta utvecklas.
   

  

 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
   

  

 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.

title: Software Developer - AI
description:
Voyado is launching a new high-impact AI initiative, and this is your chance to get in at the very beginning. As part of this growing team together with Alexander, Stefan, Etienne and Robin, you won't just work with AI. You'll get to shape how we embed it into the heart of our products and bring value for thousands of users every day.
   

  

 This is not a role where it’s just about coding; it's about driving the future direction and strategy of Voyado’s AI capabilities. Here you'll have the unique opportunity to be involved in every stage of product development, from initial discovery all the way through to deployment. Your expertise will help shape how we innovate and deliver value across the entire tech stack, from UX to cloud and give you autonomy with the backing of Voyado’s commitment to innovation and experimentation.
   

  

**Some of the things you’ll be up to:**
* Build Voyado’s core AI capability and set the standards for both intuitive AI implementation and our AI architecture.
* Collaborating closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Developers to continuously innovate and refine AI-driven experiences.
* Prototyping and scaling advanced LLM services for tasks such as content generation, translations, and workflow automation.
* Setting standards for AI model evaluation, observability, performance optimization, cost control, and ethical usage.
* Designing and building powerful AI toolboxes and SDKs (.NET-friendly) that simplify AI integration for other product teams.
* Acting as an AI evangelist across Voyado, empowering teams to confidently adopt and leverage AI capabilities.


 You’ll help build Voyado’s core AI agent, connecting seamlessly across our entire platform, dramatically enhancing how users interact with our solutions. Your work will transform AI from a feature into a fundamental aspect of our product experience.
   

  

**So, who are you?**
 We’re looking for an experienced engineer passionate about pioneering new AI-driven solutions. And in order to do that we believe that you have some of the following experiences:
   

  

* 5+ years building full-stack web products with modern backend languages (C#, Java, Python, Go) and frontend frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, Svelte) and TypeScript.
* Skilled in LLM stack technologies such as prompt engineering, RAG, fine-tuning.
* Practical experience with agent frameworks like Semantic Kernel, LangChain, or AutoGen, or equivalent libraries for orchestrating complex LLM workflows.
* Background designing robust cloud-native solutions on Azure or AWS.
* Foundational knowledge of machine learning principles (neural networks, genetic algorithms).


 If you also are curious, collaborative, and thrive when tackling complex, innovative challenges, this is a perfect match for you! This is your chance to shape an entirely new AI platform from the ground up.
   

  

 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Game Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Game Development at Coody, you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, in fields such as Games, AR/VR, Music, and other forms of interactive media. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, artists, producers, and product managers.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see every challenge as an opportunity to grow. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year for companies in industries that you’re passionate about.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re after talented game developers who love to build immersive experiences and bring ideas to life. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy pushing technical boundaries, and want the freedom to work on exciting projects - without the corporate nonsense.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development.
* Hands-on experience with building games, VR/AR, or similar interactive experiences.
* Solid skills in modern C++, Lua, AngelScript, or web technologies.
* Experience from Unreal Engine (a bonus).
* A relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or similar.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: AI Full-Stack Engineer / Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

 We’re seeking an experienced
 **AI Full-Stack Engineer / Developer (m/f/d)** 
 responsible for developing and implementing end-to-end solutions that incorporate artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities while maintaining expertise in both front-end and back-end development.
   

  

 This AI Engineer / Developer (m/f/d) plays a key role in developing and deploying AI-driven applications by working across the entire technology stack—both frontend and backend—while integrating machine learning models into production systems.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between AI research and real-world applications by integrating AI models into scalable, user-friendly software solutions.
   

  

 Location: Schaffhausen in Switzerland (Xylem Europe Headquarter) or Sundbyberg in Sweden.
   

  

**Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities**
**AI/ML Development**
* Design and implement machine learning models and algorithms (e.g., NLP, computer vision, recommendation systems)
* Deploying AI models into applications using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch or Scikit-Learn.
* Optimizing models for performance, scalability, and efficiency
* Develop and maintain AI-powered features and functionalities
* Optimize ML models for production environments
* Integrate AI services and APIs into existing applications


**Full-Stack Development**
* Building and managing APIs to serve AI models (e.g., Flask, FastAPI, or Django).
* Handling data processing pipelines and integrating AI models with databases and cloud services
* Ensuring security, authentication, and access control for AI services
* Enhancing UX/UI by leveraging AI capabilities (e.g., personalized recommendations, intelligent automation).
* Deploying AI models to production environments (cloud/on-premise) using Docker, Kubernetes, or serverless computing
* Automating CI/CD pipelines for AI applications
* Familiarity with deep learning architectures
* Develop RESTful APIs and microservices
* Implement database solutions and data pipelines
* Ensure cross-platform compatibility and responsive design
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code


**Performance, Optimization and Scaling**
* Ensuring AI applications are scalable and performant under different workloads
* Optimizing API response times and reducing computational costs
* Implementing caching strategies, parallel processing, and distributed computing


**Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Additional certifications in AI/ML or product management (preferred)
* 5+ years of full-stack development experience
* 3+ years of experience with AI/ML technologies
* Programming – Python, JavaScript (Node.js), Java, or Go
* AI/ML Frameworks – TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenCV, Hugging Face
* Backend – Flask, FastAPI, Django, Node.js
* Frontend – React, Angular, Vue.js
* Databases – PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis
* Cloud & DevOps – AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
* MLOps – Model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management
* Proven track record of successful AI project implementations
* Excellent communication skills
* Team collaboration
* Project management capabilities
* Ability to work in fast-paced environments


**We Offer You More Than Just “A Job”**
* Professional Development – To advance the capabilities of our people, we offer a wide variety of experiences to support our employees’ professional growth and continuous learning.
* Total Rewards – We offer comprehensive programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, work-life integration and corporate citizenship.
* Watermark – Watermark is our corporate social responsibility program working to provide education and access to safe water to ensure healthy lives, gender equality, and resilient communities. Employees can learn and volunteer on various water-related projects.
* Employee Networks – Our Employee Networks provide a professional, supportive network for employees from diverse backgrounds, including Women’s, LGBT+ and Allies, Veteran’s, People of Color and Allies, Emerging Leaders, and Working Parents Networks.


 For questions regarding this opportunity, please reach out to Niklas Naunheim, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at +49 1621374371.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 Xylem is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of inclusion and belonging in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: Backend Engineer - Music
description:
The Rights Systems team is driving the technical foundations of a step-change for Spotify’s business by enabling the distribution of new forms of content across the platform. This challenge involves detection of rights-protected intellectual property and facilitating rightsholder and creator management of both the rights-protected IP and the secondary content. The journey ahead will present the team with the chance to collaborate with teams across the company (Content Platform, Financial Engineering, Label Partnership, Licensing, and others) in order to create and present novel content datasets to end-users. As the product matures, the team will stretch as they scale to broader use cases and a larger user base. Being a cornerstone of the company’s video-first strategy, the rights systems solution space will be an area of investment and growth for the company over the next 2-5 years, and the team is projected to grow from a single squad to a product area.
   

  

 The squad on which this role is a founding member will specialize in Rights data, creating a net new domain within Spotify’s data landscape that is a system of record for IP rights ownership of the content we have on platform at Spotify.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work with a fullstack team to build and launch backend services & data pipelines that power a new rights database to serve as a source of truth for Spotify.
* Work closely with product, insights, design and other backend engineers to understand the needs our of external customers and internal partners (Music Expression, Content Platform, Financial Engineering, Licensing & Publishing).
* Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality backend code.
* Maintain data pipelines that undergird our Rights ecosystem.
* Support timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs.
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices.
* Work with external teams when needed to deliver consumer video experiences in the Spotify consumer application.
* Contribute to a healthy, collaborative team culture in line with what we value.
* Contribute to our team-wide product ideation in collaboration with other specialists, researchers, product managers, and subject-matter experts on the team.
* Work in an environment that supports your individual growth by providing you with exciting work, the freedom to acquire new skills on hack days, reading groups, and a variety of internal training courses.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong command of backend development best practices and a proven track record of delivering DRY, maintainable code that scales across all levels of production-level traffic.
* You are experienced in designing and building distributed, high-volume services in Java or similar languages.
* You have a working understanding of delivering data solutions using Scio and Scala.
* You have some exposure to data warehouses such as BigQuery, Snowflake, etc., and orchestration platforms like Flyte.
* You are accustomed to supporting high throughput user-facing systems in production and apply your learnings from prior incidents when building new features.
* You own your solutions end-to-end, from scoping tickets through to deployment and smoke testing your features in production.
* You ensure the quality of your code with modern testing, debugging and automation techniques.
* You have a solid understanding of object-oriented and functional programming paradigms.
* You proactively identify tech debt and work with your team to get it prioritized.
* You’re interested in rounding out your data skillset to make yourself a stronger web developer.
* You care about software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs gluing them together.
* You’re excited to learn new problem spaces and domainsYou prioritize team success to create further opportunity for yourself and teammates.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 As we continue to experience significant growth, we are looking for a backend developer, with
 **strong leadership skills** 
 , to join a team working with managed deposits, bank integrations and payments. You will have the opportunity to shape the product as part of a cross-functional team, where your decision making skills and expertise will be highly valued.
   

  

 You’ll join a team working across two technology platforms: our Java-based system for managed deposits and our PHP platform for property management. The Java platform manages B2B transactions with banking partners through APIs and backend services built on Java 17, Spring Boot, and Dropwizard, with a UI built in Vaadin. This system runs in containerized Linux environment, and is deployed via GitHub workflows and monitored with Prometheus and Grafana. While your primary focus will be on the Java stack, you’ll also contribute to our PHP platform. Strong Java skills are essential, and experience with PHP and the LAMP stack is highly valuable for this collaborative role.
   

  

 Our agile approach, along with our emphasis on close teamwork and communication, creates an environment where your contributions make a real impact. Collaboration and helping each other are integral to our culture, and you will play a key role in every aspect of the development process, from ideation to architecture to release. We work closely with our end users, gathering feedback that helps us continuously improve.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You thrive in a dynamic business environment that is constantly evolving, where you have the freedom to take initiative and implement your ideas. You strive for excellence in everything you do and always aim to deliver your best. You are not concerned with prestige and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment.
   

  

**Experience**
* 5+ years of professional experience in backend development using Java.
* Expertise in Spring Boot for building robust and scalable microservices.
* Experience in building and maintaining integrations to banking and payment systems is a plus.
* Experience with PHP is a plus.
* Proven experience working in a modern CI/CD pipeline.
* Proven experience in using docker and Linux.
* Solid understanding of RESTful APIs and experience with building and consuming APIs in a microservices environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an Agile/Scrum environment.
* Team Lead experience
* Experience in PropTech or FinTech sectors is a plus.
* Fluency in English is required, Swedish is a plus.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development


**Location**
 Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #d

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Design and develop robust AI/ML-based software solutions, including experimentation with large datasets, model selection, feature engineering, evaluation, deployment, and production monitoring.
* Build and maintain scalable data and ML infrastructure, supporting robust data pipelines and model lifecycle management.
* Apply software engineering principles and design patterns to machine learning codebases, ensuring performance, maintainability, and reusability.
* Create tools, services, and reusable components that support efficient ML development (e.g., feature stores, model registries, A/B testing frameworks, and observability tools).
* Work in cross-functional agile teams alongside data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to build production-grade ML systems and foster a data-driven culture.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (BSc/MSc) – or equivalent hands-on experience.
* 5–10 years of industry experience, including 3+ years as a professional software developer and a transition into machine learning engineering.
* Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in building and maintaining production systems.
* Proven experience deploying machine learning models in production and working with modern MLOps practices (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, containerization, automated testing).
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (preferably Google Cloud Platform and Vertex AI) and scalable compute solutions.
* Experience working with large-scale, heterogeneous datasets (streaming and batch), including strong knowledge of data storage, processing frameworks, and data structures.
* Practical knowledge of ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn) and ability to select the right tool for the problem at hand.
* Comfort working in agile environments, collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, and contributing to shared goals and deliverables.


**Meritorious**
* Experience building ML platforms or developer tools.
* Exposure to experimentation platforms and statistical evaluation techniques.
* Familiarity with DevOps tools and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes).


**Application deadline:** 
 30-05-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: System Developer - Core Team
description:
RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking to add more talented developers to our oncology information system RayCare, specifically to our Core team which is responsible for framework development.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative oncology information system (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up. RayCare is integrated with RayStation and its treatment tools but also with external products and supports communication via HL7 as well as DICOM.
   

  

 In the Core team you will mainly work with developing and improving our mission-critical event sourcing and micro service framework as well as installation and security aspects for the RayCare product.
   

  

 As a part of the Core team, you have the possibility to work with a variety of interesting and challenging tasks together with talented colleagues and contribute to evolving the platform and ensuring that it meets the high requirements on patient safety, robustness and availability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a core team developer, you will be part of designing and implementing a robust and modern software platform for our oncology information system. We believe you are a hands-on system developer with great problem-solving skills and a meticulous and structured approach. RayCare has high demands on sustainable software development ensuring excellent code quality and maintaining best practices. In your everyday work, you continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal of achieving a highly structured large scale software product. You are always open to discuss overall design within and between teams, valuing collaboration and your colleagues input to find the best solution for the problem at hand.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have excellent analytic skills and can identify different components of problems, see connections between them, and understand the impact of various proposed solutions. You take responsibility for your work, ensuring that nothing is overlooked when implementing new functionality. You value collaboration, share knowledge with you team, and take pride in delivering high-quality code that supports the teams’ and organization's goals.
   

  

**Requirements**
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering physics or equivalent academic degree
* Minimum five years of backend development experience with complex products
* Expertise in C#/.NET
* Proficient with SQL Server
* Experience with client-server based systems
* Knowledge of domain-driven design
* Knowledge of event-sourcing


**Meriting**
* Experience of working in an agile environment
* Experience from the MedTech-industry or other regulated industries
* Experience of framework development of mission critical systems
* Experience from microservice architectures
* Knowledge of CQRS/CQS
* High performance computing (multi-threaded/async software)
* Messaging systems such as RabbitMQ
* Experience with security technologies such as; OpenID Connect, certificates, IdentityServer/OpenIddict


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: .NET System Developer
description:

title: Embedded Developer

At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
   

  

 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
