title: Machine Learning Engineer, II
description:
The Personalization team makes decisions about what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them.
   

  

 We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer II to join our product area of hardworking engineers that are passionate about connecting new and emerging creators with users via recommendation algorithms. As an integral part of the squad, you will collaborate with engineers, research scientists and data scientists in prototyping and productizing state-of-the-art ML.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s personalization products by hands-on ML development
* Collaborate with a cross functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
* Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
* Promote and role-model best practices of ML systems development, testing, evaluation, etc., both inside the team as well as throughout the organization
* Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in Europe (and across Spotify) collaborating with one another
* Together with a wide range of collaborators, help develop a creator-first vision and strategy that keeps Spotify at the forefront of innovation in the field.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong background in machine learning, enjoy applying theory to develop real-world applications, with experience and expertise in bandit algorithms, LLMs, general neural networks, and/or other methods relevant to recommendation systems
* You have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java, Scala, Python, or similar languages. Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc. is a strong plus
* You have some experience with large scale, distributed data processing frameworks/tools like Apache Beam, Apache Spark, or even our open source API for it - Scio, and cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
* You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation
* You love your customers even more than your code


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the European region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the GMT/CET time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Launch Your Career in Supply Chain Technology Consulting - Join our 1-year Nordic Graduate Program!
description:
**Launch Your Career in Supply Chain Technology Consulting**
**– Join our 1-year Nordic Graduate Program!**
**SAP Supply Chain Management Graduate | Start Date: September 1, 2025**
 Location: Stockholm | Part of a Nordic Graduate Program
   

  

 At
 **NTT DATA Business Solutions** 
 , we’re currently recruiting an SCM Graduate with focus on
 **SAP Supply Chain Management** 
 to join our
 **1-year Nordic Graduate Program** 
 , starting in September 2025.
   

  

 Are you about to, or have recently, graduated from University with an Academic Degree in Informatics, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Logistics/Supply Chain Management or similar? Our Trainee Program will help you launch your career.
   

  

 You'll become part of a fast-growing, international tech consultancy firm and receive hands-on experience, real client exposure, and expert mentoring from day one.
   

  

 This is your opportunity to work with some of the largest companies in Sweden and help them navigate financial transformation using the latest SAP technologies.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Join a Nordic graduate team and take part in a structured training program for future consultants.
* Develop core consulting skills while specializing in Supply Chain Management (e.g., Warehouse Management, Material Flow Optimization, Transportation Management, Yard Management and SAP technologies/products.
* Work toward certifications in relevant SAP S/4HANA modules.
* Get involved in real client projects from the beginning, working alongside experienced consultants and with the support of a dedicated mentor.
* Gain valuable experience across industries and build a strong foundation in business technology consulting.


**What You Can Expect**
* A one-year graduate program including training sessions, social activities, and a final presentation to company leadership.
* Exposure to the latest SAP solutions, including SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, and On-Premise) and tools for process optimization.
* The opportunity to contribute to some of Sweden’s most exciting SAP S/4HANA implementations.
* A flexible, modern work environment where you have autonomy to influence your own schedule and growth path.
* A strong professional network and an inspiring team with high levels of expertise.
* An informal company culture that values collaboration, learning, and having fun at work.
* Excellent career development opportunities in a fast-growing consultancy company.
* Competitive compensation and employment terms.


**What We’re Looking For**
* A relevant an Academic Degree in Informatics, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Logistics/Supply Chain Management or similar.
* A strong interest digital transformation, and technology.
* A proactive mindset, strong communication skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* A collaborative approach and a positive, engaging attitude.
* The ability to work independently and take initiative.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.
* Willingness to travel within the Nordics as needed.


**Interested?**
 If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for, send us your CV along with a short introduction about yourself.
   

  

**Apply now—we look forward to hearing from you!**
**Why Join Us?**
 NTT DATA Business Solutions is a Global SAP Platinum Partner and SAP Global Strategic Service Provider with 20.000+ SAP experts as your colleagues that leverages cutting-edge technology worldwide. As part of NTT DATA with 200.000+ employees we are shaping the future of technology.
   

  

 Our culture is one of collaboration, inclusion, and innovation. We believe in empowering our employees, celebrating diversity, and driving change in the industry. At NTT DATA Business Solutions in Sweden, we continue to grow and win new, exciting projects. We also have a strong collaboration across our organization, with an increasing number of international projects and career opportunities.
   

  

*We encourage all interested candidates to apply for the position. At NTT DATA Business Solutions, we believe in equal opportunities for everyone and welcome applications regardless of gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, or other personal characteristics. We value diversity and inclusion in our workplace.*

title: Data Engineer Content - Schibsted
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Broadcast Media Production and Distribution, and Internet Marketplace Platforms
description:
At Schibsted, we are reimagining how data powers high-quality journalism. Our mission is to build a best-in-class data ecosystem that fuels editorial insight, optimizes content workflows, and helps newsrooms work smarter—not harder.
 



  





 We are now hiring a Data Engineer to join our growing Content Data team. In this role, you'll help develop the data infrastructure that supports everything from article creation to content distribution and performance tracking. You’ll make it easier for editors, product managers, and analysts to understand what resonates with audiences—and why.
 



  





 Based in Stockholm, you’ll work in a collaborative, impact-driven environment where data is central to how we create, measure, and evolve content experiences across the Nordics. You'll contribute to systems that support automation, metadata standardization, video and audio analytics, and cross-brand editorial insights.
 



  





**What will you do in this role?** 




  





 This is a hands-on and high-impact role, where you’ll work across the full data lifecycle—from infrastructure to insight. You will:
 



  




* Develop ETL/ELT pipelines to integrate large datasets from diverse sources into centralized data warehouses, data lakes, or other storage systems
* Integrate diverse data sources (structured and unstructured), enabling consistent, high-quality datasets for analytics and machine learning
* Build systems that power real-time personalization, editorial performance, A/B testing, audience engagement, and more
* Implement and maintain tracking solutions and event pipelines to ensure trustworthy data across products
* Collaborate closely with analysts, data scientists, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure data products align with business goals
* Support lighter analysis tasks when needed and help make data accessible and actionable through tools like Tableau, Amplitude, Kilkaya, and Streamlit
* For senior roles: Lead complex data architecture work, guide standards across teams, and mentor peers



  





**We are looking for the following experience:** 




  




* 3+ years of experience in a professional software/data engineering role
* Proficiency in Python, Scala, or Java
* Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data modeling in analytical environments
* Hands-on experience with modern data pipelines and orchestration tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow)
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (especially AWS) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform)
* Understanding of agile workflows and software engineering best practices (e.g. version control, CI/CD)
* Bonus: experience working with event data, editorial tools, or media analytics



  





**Our tech stack:** 




  




* Data platform: AWS, Snowflake, S3, Redshift
* Transformation and orchestration: dbt, Airflow, Prefect
* Programming and scripting: Python, SQL, R
* Exploration and delivery: Tableau, Amplitude, Streamlit, Kilkaya



  





**Who you are:** 




  





 We believe you are independent and structured, with a strong drive to make an impact. You are communicative and collaborative, thriving at the intersection of tech, product, business, and editorial. Your curiosity and business mindset help you see how data can be turned into real value, and you are confident in bringing clarity and transparency to complex environments.
 



  





**Why we enjoy working here:** 




  





 At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. You’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive workplace that encourages bold thinking and continuous learning. Our work directly supports public interest journalism—and we take that responsibility seriously.
 



 Whether you’re enabling better content decisions, driving user personalization, or shaping experimentation at scale, your contributions will help shape the future of digital media in the Nordics.
 



  





 You will be joining a collaborative, impact-driven team that works across disciplines like technology, product, and editorial. We believe in structured yet flexible ways of working, balancing clear ownership with strong teamwork. Curiosity, openness, and a drive to create value through data are at the heart of how we operate. We support each other, celebrate continuous learning, and are passionate about turning complex challenges into meaningful solutions for our users and brands.
 



  





**Application process** 
 :
 



 Please apply for this position by sharing your CV with us and a letter of motivation. You are welcome to write it in Swedish. Selection of candidates takes place on an ongoing basis during the process.

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who we are looking for:**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We also believe you have:**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1
   

  

*On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Regional Marketing Coordinator - EMEA North
description:
Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.
   

  

**What is The Role:**
 We are seeking a Marketing Coordinator to assist and support the Regional Marketing Manager with the execution and roll-out of a wide variety of Elastic programs in the EMEA North region consisting of the 11 countries of Benelux, Nordics, and Baltics. This role will primarily focus on Benelux & Nordics and involves close collaboration & teamwork across various key stakeholders regionally and EMEA-wide, including marketing teams responsible for specific functions and operations that drive growth and enhance our market presence. Our ideal candidate is someone with a flair for balancing multiple projects at once and enjoying the opportunity to explore various areas of marketing.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing:**
* Support the execution of regional marketing programs and campaigns online and offline including but not limited to field events, online campaigns, in-person campaigns, account programs, third party programs, own programs, digital programs, social media, C-level programs, and trade-shows.
* Coordinate the set-up, logistics, and administration of programs and their elements in internal digital systems and in real life, and work closely with various teams such as operations, design, product marketing, brand, community, to ensure processes move forward in an aligned, coordinated, efficient, and timely manner.
* Handle ongoing projects with proactivity such as maintaining and monitoring our marketing calendar, monitoring speaking opportunities and collecting information for relevant programs, events and new creative campaigns across the North region.
* Offer overall support when needed with a high level of accountability & independence, including handling shipments, staffing Elastic events, coordinating speakers & agendas, travel, planning, expense reporting, vendor management, venue sourcing, attending/presenting during meetings, and more!
* Help manage our email marketing efforts including program invitations, monthly newsletters, follow-up emails with clear segmentations and targeting, within the framework of our operation’s teams guidance
* Support our social selling on LinkedIn & various other channels and manage program postings on social media channels.
* Assist with local & regional partner initiatives, including seminars, webinar, lunch & learns, region launches.


**What You Bring:**
* 2-3 years of experience in marketing, project management, event management, or related fields.
* Great communications skills in English, both verbally and written.
* Highly organized with a keen eye for detail.
* Hands-on and proactive.
* Experience building invites, pages, with Marketo, Splash, SFDC, or other similar platforms (preferred).
* Team-worker who is also able to carry out tasks independently.
* Flexibility and willingness to adapt to the dynamic environment within a complex matrix set-up.
* Willingness to travel around 15% within the region
* Creative problem solver with the ability to propose scalable program ideas.


**Additional Information - We Take Care of Our People:**
 As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
   

  

 We strive to have parity of benefits across regions, and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
   

  

* Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
* Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
* Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
* Generous number of vacation days each year
* Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service
* Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love
* Embracing parenthood with a minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave


 Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.
   

  

 We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate\_accessibility@elastic.co. We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.
   

  

 Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws and can view the following posters linked below:
   

  

 Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster
   

  

 Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster
   

  

 Elasticsearch develops and distributes technology and information that is subject to U.S. and other country export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Russia, Syria, the Crimea Region of Ukraine, the Donetsk People’s Republic (“DNR”), and the Luhansk People’s Republic (“LNR”). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic

title: Professional Services Consultant - Nordics
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you someone who likes to use your creativity and problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide best in class solutions to clients needs?
   

  

 Do you enjoy communicating and collaborating with both internal and external teams of technical and non-technical people, designing, presenting and demonstrating the value-add your solutions can bring?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Professional Services Consultant to join our team in Sweden. Read on for more information…
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will be an important member of our Professional Services team, dedicated to the success of customers’ virtualization strategies and their implementations. With your colleagues you will ensure that customers successfully implement Quadient’s solutions, and as a Professional Services Consultant, you will influence the success of each implementation, forming a vital link between the customer and Quadient.
   

  

 We’ve learned that if we put our thinking and efforts together, we’ll achieve better results for decisions big and small. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute at a high level because the way we see it, your input broadens our perspective as well as yours.
   

  

 You’ll engage with sales, pre-sales and project management, defining the services portion of our solution proposal, and you’ll meet with customers to clarify system specifications, gaining an understanding of their work practices and the nature of their business, in order to develop a solution to meet their needs.
   

  

 You will develop and implement agreed custom solutions, testing and installing custom software solutions, and you’ll present solutions in written or oral form, preparing documentation and presenting progress reports to customers while also working on, and organizing the delivery of projects.
   

  

 You’ll maintain integrity and professionalism when working with sensitive customer data and information, and you will also conduct training for users and other consultants, occasionally travelling to client sites.
   

  

**Your profile**
* You have proven experience in the development of custom solutions, you’ve potentially worked in a software development environment and you’re looking for a role that puts you in front of the customer.
* You’re able to demonstrate working knowledge or recent experience with scripting languages (Java), application development, databases and analytical tools and design functional specifications.
* You can quickly explore, examine and understand complex problems and how it relates to the customer’s business, and you can collaborate and listen with technical and non-technical consumers from IT administrators to executive level stakeholders.
* You’re well organized with a healthy sense of urgency, you’re able to set; communicate; and meet challenging deadlines with competing priorities.
* You can demonstrate your understanding of common enterprise applications and experience with both Windows and Unix operating systems; you’re comfortable on the command line interface.
* You enjoy the opportunity to travel, and you’re excited at the prospect of travelling mainly within Sweden to various clients.
* You are a great communicator, fluent in both Swedish & Enlgish, and you can deliver impact through adapting your style to your audience.


**Ready to lead the way? Apply now.**
**Rewards & Benefits**
**Flexible Work** 
 : Embrace a hybrid work model blending office and remote setup for a balanced lifestyle.
   

  

**Endless Learning:** 
 Access global opportunities for growth through our 24/7 online learning platform.
   

  

**Inclusive Community:** 
 Join our Empowered Communities and engage in our Philanthropy program.
   

  

**Comprehensive Rewards:** 
 Enjoy competitive Total Rewards covering wellness, work/life balance, and more, including a generous referral scheme.
   

  

**Caring for Wellbeing** 
 : Access our complimentary employee assistance program for mental health support.
   

  

**Smart Work at Quadient**
 At Quadient, our Smart Work approach fosters connection, collaboration, and innovation while offering flexibility based on role requirements. Whether on-site, hybrid, or remote, our work environments are designed to support productivity and engagement. Hybrid employees balance remote and in-office work, on-site roles contribute daily to our vibrant workplace culture, and remote employees stay connected through virtual collaboration and in-person events. No matter where you work, you’ll be part of a dynamic, people-first community that drives success together.
   

  

**Be yourself at Quadient**
 Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They inspire us to be EPIC. Together. What makes Quadient different is how different we are. We’re a team of individuals with one goal but many perspectives. When you connect with Quadient, you become part of a community that cares - in a culture that embraces differences and values every voice.
   

  

 We will consider any reasonable modifications to the interview process. If you require any assistance with the application process, please email us at career@quadient.com
   

  

*Quadient is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. \*: We firmly believe in zero discrimination in employment on any basis, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, citizenship status, and any other characteristics protected by local, state, or federal law.*
**People. Connected.**
**#REMOTE**

title: Delivery Consultant, ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Strong Databases experience
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Swedish language


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2990826

title: Sr. Sales Account Executive
description:
**The Big Picture** 
 We're looking for a sales rockstar to drive strategic enterprise sales for Tungsten Automation Corporation's intelligent automation platform. You'll be orchestrating enterprise deals that make your colleagues jaws drop, helping major enterprises transform their business processes through our unique combination of RPA, cognitive capture, and analytics.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Hunt and close new business within your assigned client base
* Build a sales pipeline 4X your target (go big or go home!)
* Orchestrate complex sales cycles with C-suite decision makers
* Cultivate at least 40 strategic relationships per account
* Partner with our lead gen and sales engineering teams
* Turn prospects into raving fans and referenceable clients


**You're Our Person If You Have**
* 5-8 years of crushing it in enterprise software sales
* A track record of consistently exceeding quotas
* Experience selling RPA, SaaS, or automation solutions
* The ability to navigate boardrooms as confidently as Zoom rooms
* A hunter's mindset with a consultant's approach
* Strategic sales methodology in your DNA
* Bachelor's degree (but your track record speaks louder)


**The Secret Sauce**
* You're part entrepreneur, part strategist, all closer
* You get energized by complex technical solutions
* You're always learning and growing
* You can spot strategic value faster than others spot problems


**The Fine Print** 
 Our platform is transforming how companies work, and we need someone who's ready to be part of that revolution. The rewards match the challenge - highly competitive compensation for highly competitive people.
   

  

 Ready to help us dominate the intelligent automation space? Game on.
   

  

***Tungsten Automation Corporation, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vets***

Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Experience Mainframe Modernization
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience

title: Delivery Consultant, ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.

title: Technical UI Artist - AAA shooter
description:
Opportunity to join a AAA team on the final stretch before release. Take the chance to be part of that crazy but magical time leading up to a launch.

**Game Boost**
--------------

### **Enabling Smooth Game Production**


We provide remote-friendly studios with stellar game developers in all crafts.

 *Free to check us out on* *LinkedIn*

 **Mission brief:**


As a part of the UI team of this AAA extraction shooter you will help create a easy to understand and visually appealing UI as the game is getting ready for release.


You'll work in Unreal to create layouts in UMG and deliver player facing visuals.

 **Details:**

* Start date: asap
* Duration: september 2025, probable extension
* Occupancy rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Level: experienced / senior
* Work set-up: remote or onsite Malmö
* Time zone: CET

 **Your player profile:**

* Strong understanding of UMG
* Excellent blueprint scripting skills
* Ability to follow a provided design
* Understanding / ability to read C++ code is a plus

**Traits:**

  

Being Self-sufficient, humble, collaborative, and open-minded will take you a long way.

 ***Note:***


We believe that the world of gaming *can* and *should* include everyone.

*Neither Game Boost, nor our clients tolerate toxic, intolerant behavior* ️

**How to Play!**


It's quick and simple since we aim for low manual data entry!


This means that you can use your LinkedIn or upload a profile of your liking.


Fill in a couple of choice questions that will help us get to know you, your skills, and also understand the basics, like when you're available, location, etc.


Yeah, that's it.


Buzz: Game Project, Assignment, Gig, Creator, Developer, Contractor, Freelancer, Self-employed, Consultant, Work-For-Hire, Co-Development, Programmer, Scripter, Software Engineer, Backend, Frontend, Fullstack, Unreal Developer, C++, UE4, UE5, Unity, Frostbite, Snowflake, Maya, Blender, Computer Games, Mobile Games, Careers in gaming, hitmarker, game jobs, remote game jobs, Google jobs

title: Power System Engineer- Automotive
description:
We are looking for a **"Power Systems Engineer"** for a global company in **Örebro.** We are looking for candidates with a minimum 3 years experience.

**Start is in June, 1 year's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

**Your tasks**


Create SW function specifications (written and with Simulink models)


System development (communication between components) and fault tracing in electrified machines


Build and structure simulation environments and methods


Support fault tracing in electric rigs


Maintain, build and structure CAN communication tools and methods


Educate engineers in working with CAN tools

**Requirements**

* Experience from design of electrical drivelines in vehicles, good technical knowledge of the components in the driveline.
* Fast to learn the drill rig application from a technical view, good at judging what the operator’s intentions and desires are. Good at machine dynamics.
* Knowledge in control theory
* Proficient user of simulation tools, specifically Simulink.
* Good knowledge of CAN, working with CAN interfaces and tools to analyse CAN data, specifically Vector CANAlyzer.
* Experience from systematic concept and/or component selection.
* Experience from vehicle duty cycle analysis and integration of duty cycle data into simulations.
* Experience from driveline simulations and modeling.
* Knowledge in writing software specifications backed up with simulation models or SW code.
* Proficient in writing and working with requirements. Good at “over the hand” judgement of what’s reasonable and what’s not.
* Proficient in setting up component/system/vehicle tests and analysing/evaluating the results.
* Experience from calibration (parameter setting) of control systems.
* Experience from PLM systems.
* Good at writing technical reports.


You can work on site in Örebro at least 60% (3 days a week).

**Valued qualifications**

* Knowledge in optimization theory
* Experience from SW rapid prototyping.
* Experience from vehicle ECU or engine ECU calibration (parameter setting).
* Experience from inverter calibration (parameter setting).
* Experience from Battery Management Systems SW.

**On a personal level**

* Eager to learn and able to work independently.
* Thorough technical interest.
* Appreciate both theoretical and practical (tests) work.


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Örebro. Start is in June, 1 year's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: iOS Engineer - Data Platform
description:
The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the frameworks, capabilities and tools needed to welcome a billion customers. Join us and help to amplify productivity, quality and innovation across Spotify.
   

  

 We are looking for an expert iOS Engineer who could help us build tools that assist Spotify's experts in understanding the needs of our listeners. You will be mostly working on the SDKs that we build for our engineers and data scientists to help them analyze user behavior data to help build the best experience for Spotify users.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Innovate at a high pace to support development at scale and become a valued member of an autonomous team of developers, designers, and product managers
* Play an important part in our engineering practices and develop impactful solutions
* Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code that will scale across a number of projects and distributed engineering teams
* Join dozens of other engineers and help to craft the direction of iOS development at Spotify, to bring the happiness of music to millions of users


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are a good communicator, an inclusive colleague and a phenomenal teammate
* You have experience as an iOS/Android Engineer, preferably at scale
* Experience with Bazel, Kotlin, Java, BigQuery, Android, C++, and build/productivity tools would be a bonus
* You have a deep understanding of modern iOS development and tools
* You know how to write readable, maintainable, performant object-oriented code in Objective-C and Swift
* You care about quality, testing practices and the overall performance of the product
* You have an excellent ability to learn, and are eager to expand your areas of exp


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* You’ll be based in our Stockholm or London office.
* We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
* Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the EMEA region in which we have a work location and is within working hours.
* Working hours? We operate within the Central European and GMT time zones for collaboration and ask that all be located in these time zones.
* Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences.
* Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Integration Specialist
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
   

  

**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
   

  

****We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration** 
 .** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
   

  

 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
   

  

*We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend our Stockholm office minimum twice per week.*
**About The Role**
 As an experienced Integration Specialist with a strong technical background and a service-oriented, customer-focused mindset, you will be joining our fantastic R&D team building smart, robust and scalable integration solutions. These will help customers to save time and errors by automating the provisioning of employee data from HCM or sales and budget data from Point-of-Sales and ERP systems to the Quinyx WFM platform.
   

  

 You will bring integration expertise and a clear vision of creating value through successful customer projects into the integration team. You will have the opportunity to design custom workflows and contribute to further improve and develop our integration landscape and offering. We are using a low-tech integration middleware which allows for data transformation through drag & drop coding. To unleash its full potential you will use your XML and XSLT skills and sometimes even write some lines of JavaScript.
   

  

 Your experience with SQL will help us to migrate legacy report functions depending on direct DB access to API based queries and workflows. Our goal is to increase customer satisfaction by professionally managing our own integration projects, supporting technical and non-technical customer stakeholders and delivering clever solutions with quick return on investment.
   

  

 Your communication and organization skills are proven throughout several years of conducting technical SaaS implementations. At Quinyx you will enjoy the company of highly competent, versatile and diverse colleagues. The teams enjoy an autonomous way of working and continuously strive to improve their own processes, tooling options and skills.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Working in a self-managing team based on Agile principles.
* Design, develop and maintain integration workflows using our Babelway integration middleware.
* Take full ownership of your projects and deliverables from kick-off to hypercare handling all customer communication in regards to integration.
* Identify, implement and communicate best practices for integration projects and design.
* Drive improvements in our integration landscape.


**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* In depth experience in integration development as part of implementation projects.
* Strong technical knowledge and experience in XML, XSLT, JSON, SQL and data transformation.
* The ability to mentor colleagues to lift the competence of your team.
* Experience in working in an Agile environment following agile methodologies.
* A self-motivated attitude with a passionate approach to problem solving, collaboration and providing exemplary customer service.
* Excellent English, both spoken and written.
* Fluent language skills in German, Dutch or Swedish.


**The WOW-factor**
* Background in software engineering/development.
* Understanding of the WFM domain.
* Prior experience with Babelway, Pentaho and other integration middleware tools.
* Prior experience in API design and testing tools like Postman, JMeter etc.
* Understanding of SQL databases.
* Familiarity with API design principles and GitHub.


**What is it for you?**
 We promote and encourage a healthy lifestyle with flexible work hours and latest tools, enhanced vacation allowance, gym membership contribution, and last but not least, you will have the chance to participate in our well-known yearly ugly Xmas sweater competition!
   

  

**Life at Quinyx**
 We are an innovative, agile and continuously growing modern tech company. We value passion, creativity, quality and simplicity. You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas and have full ownership of your area.
   

  

 Our global team, of 40 nationalities, have fun together whether it is during a typical Swedish Fika, workshop, going for a run with a colleague or spending time together during our regular after-work socials. We have built a family atmosphere here at Quinyx and are committed to share knowledge and support one another!
   

  

**Want to join the family?**
 At Quinyx, we provide equal employment opportunities and we strive to have an inclusive and diverse value-driven culture. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability or Veteran status.
   

  

**Happy Workforce, Happy Business!**
*All candidates are subject to background checks.*
